description: Ever since she entered high school, Kotoko Aihara wanted to be in the same class as Naoki Irie. The only problem is that Irie is the smartest student in school in contrast to Kotoko being one of the dumbest. Now in her 3rd year of high school, she still isn't there. However, one day her home gets destroyed and the only place left to go to is Irie's home. Now that she lives close to him, will their relationship be the same, or will it become greater than it is?

tags.name: Tsundere
tags.description: Prominently features a character who acts cold and hostile in order to mask warmer emotions.

tags.name: Shoujo
tags.description: Target demographic is teenage and young adult females.

tags.name: Love Triangle
tags.description: Centered around romantic feelings between more than two people. Includes all love polygons.

tags.name: Coming of Age
tags.description: Centers around a character's transition from childhood to adulthood.

tags.name: Primarily Adult Cast
tags.description: Main cast is mostly composed of characters above a high school age.

tags.name: Heterosexual
tags.description: Prominently features a romance between a man and a woman, not inherently sexual.

tags.name: Primarily Teen Cast
tags.description: Main cast is mostly composed of teen characters.

tags.name: Medicine
tags.description: Centered around the activities of people working in the field of medicine.

tags.name: School
tags.description: Partly or completely set in a primary or secondary educational institution.

tags.name: Marriage
tags.description: Centers around marriage between two or more characters.

tags.name: Work
tags.description: Centers around the activities of a certain occupation.

tags.name: College
tags.description: Partly or completely set in a college or university.

tags.name: Time Skip
tags.description: Features a gap in time used to advance the story.

tags.name: Language Barrier
tags.description: A barrier to communication between people who are unable to speak a common language.

tags.name: Tennis
tags.description: Centers around the sport of tennis.

tags.name: Family Life
tags.description: Centers around the activities of a family unit.

tags.name: LGBTQ+ Themes
tags.description: Prominently features characters or themes associated with the LGBTQ+ community, such as sexuality or gender identity.

node.description:
[Website](https://tadakaoru.jp/) | [Facebook](https://www.facebook.com/itakissdaisuki)

Tada made her debut in 1977, when still a high-school student, on Shueisha's "Deluxe Margaret" magazine. Tada's stories belong to the shoujo genre of manga and feature love stories centered around young female characters and their love interests. The storylines include comedic moments and are characterised by essential and sharp drawings. Some of Tada's most popular works are Aishite Knight, Itazura na Kiss and Kimi no Na wa Deborah.

Aishite Knight portrays the Japanese rock music scene of the early 1980's. The anime series based on Ai Shite Knight was the first ever to feature original songs performed within the episodes. Another of Tada's works, Miha Paradise is also set in the rock 'n' roll world.

Her work "Itazura na Kiss" is a gem to the shoujo demographic, as it is the mother of a lot of cliches found in today's shoujo series. Despite the fact that it is 2 decades old, it still stands out as unique for it has the series follow the main characters well into their life, over a span of 10 years. It was so popular it inspired popular series like Marmalade Boy and Fruits Basket.

However, the author had an accident while she was moving homes with her son and husband, and passed away a few months later, leaving her popular manga forever uncompleted. It was adapted into a popular Taiwanese drama under the title "It Started With a Kiss", and it even earned sequel. It was also adapted as a short Japanese drama in 1996, and an anime series in 2008, with the anime portraying the author's planned ending.

[Website](http://remi-stargarnet.net/) | [Twitter](https://twitter.com/Remi_Official) | [Instagram](https://www.instagram.com/remi_stargarnet/)

REMI is a female singer born in Tokyo, Japan. She is currently a member of [Sound Horizon](https://anilist.co/staff/100754/) and often works on [Yasuharu Takanashi](https://anilist.co/staff/100070)'s soundtracks.
AZU started singing at the age of 16 and debuted in her own right in 2007. She has worked with Seamo.
Originating from [Nomad](https://anilist.co/studio/70/), where she initially worked as a production assistant.

Yamamoto Yasuichirou is a director. He is best known as the current director of the Meitantei Conan franchise.
**Tomoko Fukunaga** is a Japanese animator and animation director.
